Our superhero friends are off to have an incredible time learning through play.
One of our MANY Incredible students
The Orchestra, Band and Silhouettes performed at the October Board of Education Meeting.

span.div: The Quality Profile provides our parents and community members another look at what our community values in our schools and provides some additional information in the areas of Academics, Arts, Student Leadership & Activities, Fiscal Stewardship, Parent & Community Involvement, Student Services, and Staff & District Recognitions.

NEW DATES FOR PROM AND GRADUATION

div.span: We are please to announce we have new dates for Prom and Graduation.

h3.a: 2020 BEST COMMUNITIES FOR MUSIC EDUCATION

div.span: We pleased to announce that Norwood City School District has been honored with the Best Communities for Music Education designation from The NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education.

h3.a: Coronavirus

div.span: A letter was emailed to our High School and Middle School families and paper form was sent to our Elementary families. Since the letter was sent on Monday morning, 3 cases have been confirmed in Ohio. Please see the updated letter

h3.a: Scholastics Art Awards for Norwood High School Students

div.span: Scholastics is a regional art competition that highlights some of the most sourstanding high school student artworks created in Southern Ohio, Northern Kentucky and Southeastern Indiana. Congratulations to Hannah Brandenbury Grade 10, Silver Key. Hayden Simpson Grade 10, Honorable Mention, Emmarose Wright Grade 10, Silver Key.In addition, we also have 2 student photographers published in Ohio Schools magazine. Jihan Gordon and John Cole submitted photos that were selected for the magazine. Congrats, gentlemen!
